channel.title: Your Success At Last DNA | Daily Motivation | Goal Setting
channel.description:
Tracy Brinkmann is an entrepreneur, author and success coach who shows people how to start again, start over and begin a fulfilling life setting goals and objectives so they can create wealth and live life of fulfillment to the fullest.
Inspiration, motivation, personal development and self-help without the "rah rah" in the spirit of Tony Robbins, Napoleon Hill, Robert Kiyosaki, Jillian Michaels, Jack Canfield and Zig Ziglar... and the Law of Attraction is discussed frequently.
Made for YOUR SUCCESS in a time where countless people, businesses and organizations urgently need a boost to get moving or even just to start at all or to just start over. In the ever and fast changing world where the weak do not alway loose to the strong, because it is the fast action takers that beat the slow, so traditional goal setting and planning are not enough. Something extra is needed today to get from where you are to where you want to be. The top percenters and "new" achievers are doing it with greater ease and speed than ever before, and you deserve to know how you can, too.
Here Tracy's inspiring thoughs will look at "rise and fall, and rise again" stories along with the new secrets of success while imparting inspiration and motivation. Learn why your success will work now when it didn't work then by implementing the often forgotten sometimes ignored, and generally underestimated, unknown steps to producing results.
Say, "Hello!" to YOUR SUCCESS AT LAST.

item.description:
Leadership is a daunting task, and there are many theories about how to best lead others. But regardless of the theory employed, there are attributes that great leaders share. With the right blend of attributes, you can thrive within any leadership system. Better yet it is Â possible to develop these characteristics with study and effort. item.title: Do Not Be A Pushover
item.dc:creator: Tracy Brinkmann | Personal Development in the spirit of Tony Robbins, Napoleon Hill, & Zig Ziglar
item.description:
Being caught constantly in situations you feel you have no control over and can't do anything about is an awful feeling and may eventually erode self-esteem. When you're the pushover and the losing party of every situation, it's time to find out what you can do to change the tide. It starts with the right mindset and determination to learn the assertiveness skills you need to stand up for yourself. If you've had a passive personality all your life, this may be a difficult task, but with a little work and understanding of yourself, you'll be able to quit being a pushover and enjoy life to the max. Let me share four great tips to be more assertive and still be the nice person you want to be to reach Your Success At Last! - CLICK & LISTEN then LIKE & SHARE!

Your Success At Last DNA | Personal Development in the Spirit of Tony Robbins, Napoleon Hill, Robert Kiyosaki, Jillian Michaels, Jack Canfield, Brian Tracy, Jim Rohn and Zig Ziglar

Think Successfully & Take Action!Tracy "Ace" Brinkmann

Â

item.title: Authentic Or Phony
item.dc:creator: Tracy Brinkmann | Personal Development in the spirit of Tony Robbins, Napoleon Hill, & Zig Ziglar
item.description:
One thing I am betting we can all agree on is that being a fake or a phony is not a positive thing -- no one wants be played by just a part acting, nor does anyone want to be know as a phony or poser. We all would much rather be authentic and live our true selves. So let me share a few ways you can easily spot both a fake and an authentic person. Also some tips on how being authentic is far more productive to reaching Your Success At Last! - CLICK & LISTEN then LIKE & SHARE!

item.title: How To Stand Out From The Crowd
item.dc:creator: Tracy Brinkmann | Personal Development in the spirit of Tony Robbins, Napoleon Hill, & Zig Ziglar
item.description:
You give your best, perform well and hope it gets you noticed, but while good performance is important and critical to advancing your career or your relationships; unfortunately, it's not always enough. Many others are doing great work as well. You have to do something, have something, or be something more than that to stand out from the crowd. How do you insure people remember you? How do you make that positive, lasting impression? What makes you different and how can you stand out from all the rest? Well let me share 6 ways so you can reach Your Success At Last! - CLICK & LISTEN then LIKE & SHARE!

Your Success At Last DNA | Personal Development in the Spirit of Tony Robbins, Napoleon Hill, Robert Kiyosaki, Jillian Michaels, Jack Canfield, Brian Tracy, Jim Rohn and Zig Ziglar

item.title: I Can't Motivation
item.dc:creator: Tracy Brinkmann | Personal Development in the spirit of Tony Robbins, Napoleon Hill, & Zig Ziglar
item.description:
Your attitude is driven by the things in your life, past, present and future that you focus upon. If you focus on the successes of your past and your present, then your future will continue with such successes. If, however, your focus is on that which you did not accomplish, then your future will be clouded with that you believe you cannot accomplish. Let me share with you three great stories of people flipping I can't on its head so you can reach Your Success At Last! - CLICK & LISTEN then LIKE & SHARE!

Your Success At Last DNA | Personal Development in the Spirit of Tony Robbins, Napoleon Hill, Robert Kiyosaki, Jillian Michaels, Jack Canfield, Brian Tracy, Jim Rohn and Zig Ziglar

item.title: Are You Influential?
item.dc:creator: Tracy Brinkmann | Personal Development in the spirit of Tony Robbins, Napoleon Hill, & Zig Ziglar
item.description:
Over the course of this and the next few episodes I am going to share some thoughts about influence, getting it, keeping it, best ways to utilize it (for good of course) why you should care etc. Will even chat about how we each exert a positive or negative influence and literally ask you the question "are you using your power?" and if you are, "Are you using it for good?" in order to reach Your Success At Last! - CLICK & LISTEN then LIKE & SHARE!

item.title: Do Your Words Hurt or Heal - The Language Of Mending Feelings
item.dc:creator: Tracy Brinkmann | Personal Development in the spirit of Tony Robbins, Napoleon Hill, & Zig Ziglar
item.description:
The words you use when you express yourself have an impact on those around you. We've all met an individual who seems unaware of how their words affect others. How about you? Do you use your words to uplift others or tear them down? Let me share some wonderful words to use often and generously. These terms usually make others feel great and go a long way toward mending relationships that require fixing and getting you one step closer towards Your Success At Last! - CLICK & LISTEN then LIKE & SHARE!

item.title: How To Avoid Boss Booby Traps

item.title: Why You Should Get A Mentor Or Coach
item.dc:creator: Tracy Brinkmann | Personal Development in the spirit of Tony Robbins, Napoleon Hill, & Zig Ziglar
item.description: Why Should You Get a Coach? Â Well...what is easier: Working toward your goals alone through trial and error, or seeking the guidance and direction of someone who's been there and done that? The answer is obvious. When you seek the advice of someone who has been through it all before, you can then avoid the same mistakes and focus your time and energy on what truly works. That's the power of a life, relationship, business, personal or even a sports coach. Imagine yourself with a set plan and just the right advice. Coaching may shave years off the time it would have taken you to reach your goals otherwise! Let me share the top 7 reasons why you need a Â coach toÂ reach Your Success At Last! - CLICK & LISTEN then LIKE & SHARE! item.title: 5 Easy Tricks To Conquer Stress At Work
item.dc:creator: Tracy Brinkmann | Personal Development in the spirit of Tony Robbins, Napoleon Hill, & Zig Ziglar
item.description: Do you feel stressed out at work? Deadlines, job insecurity, and dealing with a difficult co-worker or supervisor are just a few of the most common sources of stress in the workplace. Unfortunately, on-the-job stress can negatively affect your health, well-being, and relationships. The good news is that regardless of the source of stress at your workplace, there are steps that you can take to defeat stress and feel more calm, centered, and in control when you are at work. Try one of these easy tricks the next time you feel stressed out at work and reach Your Success At Last! - CLICK & LISTEN then LIKE & SHARE! item.title: 3 Strategies To Let Go Of Past Mistakes And Move Forward
item.dc:creator: Tracy Brinkmann | Personal Development in the spirit of Tony Robbins, Napoleon Hill, & Zig Ziglar
item.description:
The most difficult person for us to forgive is usually ourselves. Regret, shame, and guilt prevent us from letting go of our past mistakes. Rather than reflecting on the experience and learning from it so that we can move forward, we tend to dwell on these unfortunate times.

By refusing to forgive ourselves of our regrets, we remain trapped in the past. The good news is that there are some simple strategies that can help you come to terms with the things that you have done in the past, learn from these missteps, and embrace a future that includes a fulfilling life. Listen to and try these strategies to help you forgive yourself and to reach Your Success At Last! - CLICK & LISTEN then LIKE & SHARE!

item.description: What To Do When You Don't Know What You Want but have to decide. Weâ€™ve all been there. Itâ€™s easy to get stuck when none of your options stand out clearly over the other(s). item.description:
Does attaining your goals seem harder than it should be?Â If you feel challenged to achieve your desires, you may be constructing false obstacles to your objectives. When we do this, we give all our power and attention to these imaginary ideas. In reality, this is simply a delay tactic. So how would you know if you were constructing false obstacles and giving away your power to them? Let me share with you some ways this shows up in your life and what you can do to take back your power and reach YOUR SUCCESS AT LAST! - CLICK & LISTEN then LIKE & SHARE!

item.description:
Â 

Most of us are constantly under pressure and on the go with our fast-paced lifestyles. It's only natural for us to occasionally feel worn out or even a bit down from time to time. The good news is that something as simple as refocusing your attention from your challenges to acknowledging the things that you are grateful for in your life can instantly boost your mood. Studies show that practicing gratitude on a regular basis can raise your mood and also boost your self-esteem, will power, long term health, and even your level of success in life! Reducing the stress in your life can and will need some reflection and it is definitely going to take some action, but it will all be well worth it. Â  By reducing your stress, you'll be able to sleep better, your outlook on live and its opportunities will improve, and will be far more able to enjoy even your simplest of daily interactions. To reduce stress, you have to work on minimizing the stressful situations in your life and to relax your head and your heart or the mind and the body. item.description:
Â 

Are you finding it tough to survive in the corporate battlefield? Everyone is always vying for that top spot, including you. But with so much competition, you're probably thinking it's next to impossible for you to come out on top. However, the reality is that working smarter, not harder, will get you any spot you set your sights on! Consider the term "creating value." Creating value means accomplishing tasks that will greatly benefit your organization, as well as making you stand out from the rest. When the powers that be are deciding on promotions, how much value youâ€™ve actually contributed to the company is what really counts! What have you contributed that will sustain the organization and allow it to grow by leaps and bounds in the future? So just how do you create value? Listen to and try these strategies to create value, regardless of your business type (and try them in your other areas of life too!): - CLICK & LISTEN then LIKE & SHARE! Most people want to be around those they have fun with. Keeping the good feelings flowing strengthens the loving bonds you have and draws you closer. Having a good laugh, sharing a new experience, and being spontaneous build a relationship thatâ€™s enjoyable as well as enduring. Make it a goal each day to bring fun into your relationship. item.title: 3 Crucial Steps To Healing a Broken Heart
item.dc:creator: Tracy Brinkmann | Personal Development in the spirit of Tony Robbins, Napoleon Hill, & Zig Ziglar
item.description:
Â 

The pain that we feel when our relationship with someone we love is ended can be very intense. Common symptoms of a broken heart include sadness, crying, and feeling physical aches and pains in the heart and body. Symptoms of your grief can interfere with your health, well-being, and ability to function in your daily life! Luckily, there are steps you can take to help you heal and move on, no matter how much time has passed since your break-up. - CLICK & LISTEN then LIKE & SHARE! item.description:
Â 

As we travel through our life's journey, many relationships will come into our lives. Some of them will be wonderful and long lasting; others, unfortunately, may be short term or unhappy. Do you tend to attract more negative relationships than positive? Though we strive to develop good, solid, and happy relationships, it seems we sometimes end up with exactly the opposite. Wouldn't you love to attract more positive relationships? The good news is, you can! Try some of these simple tips to enjoy more positive relationships in your life! - CLICK & LISTEN then LIKE & SHARE! item.title: Are You Dooming Yourself To Failure
item.dc:creator: Tracy Brinkmann | Personal Development in the spirit of Tony Robbins, Napoleon Hill, & Zig Ziglar
item.description:
Â 

Much of our happiness and success is the result of our thinking. So, too, are our failures. And our thoughts are revealed in how we speak to ourselves as well as others. What you say to yourself during the course of the day largely determines the outcome. Like an evil mist, negative thinking has an insidious way of weaving its wispy tendrils into our thoughts and words. Over time, it becomes a habit â€“ so much so that you might not even notice it. But you canâ€™t help but notice the result: failure, time and time again. The solution is to develop new habits in your thinking so lets chat a bit about what signs to watch for and how to overcome them. - CLICK & LISTEN then LIKE & SHARE!
